section_title: Variables and Data Types in Python
section_description: This section provides practical, hands-on experience with Python's fundamental data storage mechanisms. Students will actively code variables, manipulate different data types, and solve real-world problems through progressive exercises that build from simple assignments to complex type conversions and validations.
learning_objectives: Create and assign values to variables following Python naming conventions
Distinguish between mutable and immutable data types through practical examples
Perform type conversions between strings, integers, and floats without errors
Implement f-strings and format methods for dynamic string construction
Validate user input using type checking and conversion techniques

lessons.lesson_title: Mastering Variable Assignment and Naming Conventions
lessons.lesson_objective: Students will correctly create 10 variables using snake_case naming and assign appropriate values without naming conflicts

exercises.exercise_instructions: Given 15 incorrectly named variables, rewrite them using proper snake_case conventions and assign meaningful values that match their purpose
Write a program that swaps values between three variables (x, y, z) using multiple assignment in a single line

lessons.lesson_title: Working with Numeric Types and Precision
lessons.lesson_objective: Students will perform calculations mixing integers and floats while maintaining precision and handling potential overflow scenarios

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create variables for principal ($1000), rate (0.05), and time (10 years), then calculate compound interest showing both integer and float results
Convert temperatures between Celsius and Fahrenheit using floating-point variables, ensuring results display exactly 2 decimal places

lessons.lesson_objective: Students will construct complex strings using f-strings, concatenation, and formatting methods to display formatted user data

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create a formatted receipt using f-strings that includes item names, quantities, prices, and calculates totals with proper alignment
Combine string variables containing different character sets to generate random passwords of specified lengths using string multiplication

lessons.lesson_title: Type Conversion and Input Validation Strategies
lessons.lesson_objective: Students will safely convert between data types while handling invalid inputs using try-except blocks and validation loops

exercises.exercise_instructions: Build a calculator that accepts string input, validates numeric conversion, and handles errors gracefully with retry opportunities
Given a list of mixed string numbers ('10', '3.14', '25'), convert them to appropriate numeric types and calculate their sum

lessons.lesson_title: Boolean Logic and None Type Applications
lessons.lesson_objective: Students will implement conditional logic using boolean variables and understand None type usage in real-world scenarios

exercises.exercise_instructions: Create boolean variables to track login status, password validity, and account lockout, then combine them for access control
Write a search function that returns None when items aren't found, demonstrating proper None checking and default value assignment
